question: Question_08_(b)
statement:
Let $y = (ax + b)^7$, where \emph{a} and \emph{b} are constant.

(b) Now suppose that $a = 0$. Find the equation of the tangent line in
this case.
sols:
If \emph{a} = 0, then the curve we are looking at is the curve

\[\displaystyle
y = (0x+b)^7 = b^7\] which is simply a horizontal line at the height
\emph{b}\textsuperscript{7} and so its tangent line is itself, that is,
the line \emph{y} = \emph{b}\textsuperscript{7}.
hints: If \emph{a} = 0, just plug that in to see what the problem becomes.
